content.webTitle: Planet Sport: Rogério Ceni, goalkeeper on his way to scoring 100 goals

fields.headline: Planet Sport: Rogério Ceni, goalkeeper on his way to scoring 100 goals
fields.bodyText: As Jermain Defoe approaches his 100th Premier League goal – he's been stuck on 97 since last April – São Paulo captain Rogério Ceni is closing on a similar feat. Time Out: São Paulo reported on the 38-year-old's ongoing attempt to reach 100 career goals – quite a feat for a goalkeeper. A penalty and free-kick specialist, Ceni scored his 98th goal last Sunday in a 3-2 win against Portuguesa, and has long since overtaken the most famous goalscoring keeper, the Paraguay international José Luis Chilavert, who retired on 62 goals. Ceni's best season was in 2005, when he scored an impressive 21. He hit eight last season and has struck three this year. He's only got egg on his face once, in a 4-3 win against Fluminense in 2002. While he was celebrating scoring a penalty, Fluminense took a quick restart and lobbed him from the halfway line. Arsenal were linked with Ceni in 2001 but nothing came of it, so Ceni remained at São Paulo, earning 17 Brazil caps and playing more games than anyone else in the history of the Brasileirão (Brazil's top league) – with 950 appearances to his name. He's refused all attempts to lure him abroad saying simply: "I like it here." As a result, he's virtually unknown outside Brazil. But when the 100 comes up, his fame is sure to spread. Paraguay: Bullet in the brain can't stop Cabañas comeback Primero de Marzo radio has good news about gunshot victim Salvador Cabañas. The 30-year-old striker was shot in a Mexico City nightclub last year, but is back in training with the Paraguay champions, Libertad, despite having the bullet still lodged in his brain. "It's an honour to have him with us. We want to do everything we can to help him," said the coach, Gregorio Pérez. Cabañas said his comeback "means everything ... It is what I want the most in the world. Little by little I am recovering and it is going great. Playing again is my biggest dream." Cabañas's alleged assailant was finally apprehended by the Mexican authorities in January after they noticed his girlfriend was unwittingly transmitting their location via Facebook. Sweden: Handball director sacked after Eurovision race slur "To think that I am a racist is sick, it is just some journalist who is looking for a story," complained the marketing director of the Swedish handball club H43, Ulf Mohlin Fagerstrom, after Swedish media highlighted some of his comments on Facebook. Judge for yourself. Here's what Mohlin Fagerstrom wrote about the black Swedish-American entrant to the Swedish Eurovision Song Contest: "Time to emigrate. A swollen nigger who doesn't speak Swedish. Which country's song contest was this?" A journalist at the local paper Sydsvenskan wrote a story about the comments and the row built – but it took four days for the club to sack him. Even then, they sounded surprised that his comments had caused so much outrage. "This became too entwined with H43's reputation and it wouldn't have worked to have him still working here," said the chairman, Bo Uddenas. "But the picture of Ulf in the media is not the Ulf I know. He did a great job in marketing. The media spotlight on the club has been unfair. You, the media, has made this into a big thing." US: Bieber tweet makes him Most Valuable Player US media reported on omnipresent teenage singer Justin Bieber winning the most valuable player trophy on Friday in an NBA All-Star pro‑celebrity game in LA. Bieber, who at 5ft 5in was dwarfed by his team‑mates, had eight points, four assists and two rebounds, but his team lost 54-49 after he missed a last-minute three-pointer. But Bieber won the MVP trophy after he tweeted to his 7.4m Twitter followers: "Everyone text 'bieber' to 69622 for me to be MVP in the allstar celeb game. I'm going in!!! Haha" ESPN reported: "Bieber spent most of the game hitching up his shorts that fell well below the knee ... "Former Los Angeles Laker Rick Fox, who patted his team-mate Bieber on the head during the game, marvelled: 'He has the softest hair.'"
